fields.description:
*Background:*

In JIRA Data Center the search index will be copied between nodes. Example reasons for the copy include when a new node is added to the cluster, or when a node starts and detects a problem with its copy of the index. 

This copy works by creating a backup zip file of the index and placing that file into the shared home. The node that needs the copy will then retrieve the copy and restore that copy. 

*Current State:* 

The logging that occurs does not allow an admin to follow this process. 
* For example, there is no log message indicating that a node has requested a copy of the index from another node. 
* On the other hand there is a log message on the node that creates the index backup.

*Suggested Change:*

Improve logging with the goal of giving JIRA admin clear indication that a node copy is happening and allowing that admin to follow the process 

---

*Examples of improvements:*

* Add log entry when a node requests an index copy. Say that a copy is being requested and include reason the node is requesting the copy 
** The message could even give a brief description of what the next step is. "Requested index backup. Restore will occur after receiving 'Index Backed Up' message from another node"
* Improve logging during index backup process. Currently there are only two entries, "Index backup started" and "Index backup complete"
** Suggestion: Add logging after each index is backed up. Similar to how the restore will log messages after certain steps are complete
fields.summary: Add additional logging related to index copy between nodes

fields.description:
h3. +Steps to reproduce+
# Install JIRA Software 7.8.0, then install JIRA Service Desk application 3.11 onto it
# Go to Manage add-ons and Enable Safe Mode
# Exit Safe Mode

h3. +Expected behavior+
All add-ons that are disabled when entering Safe Mode are re-enabled when exiting Safe Mode

h3. +Actual behavior+
Most JIRA Service Desk add-ons and some JIRA Software language add-ons are *not* re-enabled:
!addon.png|thumbnail!

(!) JIRA Service Desk application becomes unavailable and no one can use Service Desk features.

h3. +Notes+
# This may have something to do with JSDSERVER-5103, where Service Desk add-ons shouldn't be disabled in the first place
# Exiting Safe Mode may fail with this error:
{code}
System failed to restore from Safe Mode. Reenabling plugin 'JIRA Service Desk Public REST API Plugin' failed while exiting safe mode.
{code}

h3. +Workaround+
* Manually enable the add-ons one by one from Manage add-ons
* If the above doesn't work:
*# Shut down JIRA
*# Run this SQL query in the db to remove the *disabled* state:
{code}delete from pluginstate;{code}
(i) This will enable all available add-ons
*# Restart JIRA
fields.summary: Exiting Safe Mode does not re-enable all apps

fields.description:
h3. Summary

If the default language is set to a language that is not English (US or UK), and if an issue is created without attachment, when we try to edit the issue, the attachment button is missing.

h3. Steps to reproduce

- In JIRA, go to ⚙ > System and change the default setting to Spanish
- Create an issue in JIRA without adding any attachment
- Click on the "edit" button and try to add an attachment to the ticket

h3. Observed Results

The button to browse for attachments is missing:
 !SpanishTranslation_AttachmentButton.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results

The button to browse for attachments should be available, as it's the case with the English language setting:
 !EnglishTranslation_AttachmentButton.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

2 possible workarounds:
# Drag an drop an attachment to the ticket. After the attachment is added, click on "Edit" and you'll see that the attachment button in now available.
# Change the language to English (US or UK)
fields.summary: The button to browse for attachments is missing from the edit screen when the default language is not English

fields.description:
*Take control + K as an example:*

When using the visual text mode -
Edge: Nothing happens
Chrome: Cursor is focused to the navigation menu

*Steps to reproduce:*
1.) Open a comment within an issue in Jira
2.) Type some text, highlight it, and the hit control + k
3.) Observe that a link is not created. What occurs varies by browser, but is either nothing or focuses the navigation bar.
If done within text mode, it works correctly.
fields.summary: Hotkeys, when in visual mode, are overwritten by browser hotkeys.

fields.description: Once you have created a link using the highlight and external link button, there is no easy way to remove the link should you want to - in that you have highlight the original text specifically, and then click the external link button again. We would like to see similar contextual functionality to Confluence in where you can highlight the link and simply choose to "unlink" it.
fields.summary: Add "unlink" function to text editor.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Any user that does not reside in the internal directory that is added via the REST API cannot be remove by using the GUI from within JIRA.

h3. Environment
Instances running MSSQL (cannot reproduce in postgres)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install and connect JIRA to MSSQL instance and have an external user directory populated with users connected
#  Use this API call to add an external user to any role other than administrator: /rest/api/2/project/{projectIdOrKey}/role/{id}
# Attempt to now remove that user via the users and roles page by clicking the trash can
# User is not removed
# You can remove the user via API

h3. Expected Results

Any user added by the API or gui should be able to be removed via both methods.

h3. Actual Results
Pressing trash can does nothing.  The request is sent to the server and processed but the actual delete statement is never run against the database, instead it skips that step and moves on to adding the deletion to the audit_log table as if it had succeeded.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When using Deutsch as the default language in Jira, 'March'/'Marz' is displayed as 'M&aumI;r'

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Change Default Language to _Deutsch (Deutschland)_
# Go to any issue which created/ updated in March
# Hover on the time for the pop-up

h3. Expected Result
JIRA should show "März" or the standard "Mrz" instead of "M&aumI;r"
(i) Note: I typed the "&aumI;" as "i" in uppercase for illustration purposes. Please assume it as "L" in lowercase.

h3. Actual Result:
!hover_on_time.png|thumbnail!

h3. Workaround

There is currently no workaround for this issue.
fields.summary: German translation error for March abbreviations when hover on date in Issue View

fields.description:

 # Change Default Language to _Deutsch (Deutschland)_
 # Go to any issue which created/ updated in March

*Expected Result:*
JIRA should show "Mrz" instead of "Mär"

*Actual Result:*
 !Screen Shot 2018-03-07 at 6.01.41 PM.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: German translation error for March abbreviations in (Issue View - Dates)

fields.description:
This questions concerns the number format for custom number fields. 

I'd like to create a number field in which I can input and view a numeric value in English scientific notation. For example 3E6, 5.91E-6 or 200.84E-1, which mean the numbers 1000000, 0.00000591, and 20.084. These numbers will be used in other fields for calculations.

For my German localization settings, I discovered that the number field can 
 * hold a 5.9E-6 which is correctly used in calculations
 * when I enter 5,9E-6 (German language settings) and 
 * displays 0

Is there a way to bring consistency to it? I'd like to have it in the 5.9E-6 format.
fields.summary: How to enter small floating point numbers

fields.description:
h3. *Summary*
When setting jira.search.view.default.max to 0, it should be no default limit. But, when we trying to use JIRA on mobile view, all filter shows a blank result. Also, if you're using the Jira REST API to make a call to retrieve some results and if you set "maxResults=1", Jira will not display any results, even though it should. 

h3. *Environment*
JIRA Version : Tested on JIRA 7.6, 7.7 and JIRA 7.8 with the same issue.

h3. *Steps to Reproduce*
# Go to Setting > System > Advance
# Set jira.search.view.default.max to 0
# Access your JIRA Instance using mobile view
# Open any filter for example: Assigned to me
(i) It should show the issue assigned to profile owner, but it shows no result. If we using same profile in desktop view, it shows results.
# Try to make run a JQL filter and set the "maxResults=1" like: JIRA_URL/rest/api/2/search?fields=summary&jql=key=SCRUM-10&maxResults=1

h3. *Expected Results*
It should show the issue assigned to profile owner when we click on issue assigned to me. 

h3. *Actual Results*
When we click issue assigned to me or any default filter, custom filter as well. Even though there are issues assigned, it will show a blank result.
fields.summary: Setting jira.search.views.default.max to 0 as No Default Limit will not work

fields.description:
I can't find any other requests for this, but it drives me up the wall that in "Manage Add-ons" if you click an "Update" button for an Add-on (or Disable also, and probably others) there is no "Are you sure?" confirmation. Several times (like two or three times - not hundreds!)  I clicked the button by mistake and it has installed, updated, disabled when I didn't want to. One time someone did that to an Add-on we didn't want to upgrade and actually broke JIRA (small thing but new tickets then couldn't be created for a while) and I had to waste time fixing it up.

Has anyone else noticed this? Is there already a request? I can't find one. If there isn't one but this has occurred to you please "upvote" or whatever we have here. Or is it just me? I don't think so.
fields.summary: Can the Add-ons "Update" button have an "are you sure?" step - please?

fields.description:
h3. Documentation Link:
 * [https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwareserver/using-jira-on-a-mobile-device-939938897.html]

h3. Issue:
 * There is come confusion whether JIRA Server is able to use the JIRA Mobile Application. This must be clear in our documenation

!Screen Shot 2018-03-06 at 3.15.07 pm.png|thumbnail!
 * Documentation talks about JIRA Server able to use the JIRA Mobile view via a Web Browser. This is correct and possible if you simply use the Mobile View via a mobile browser and not our Mobile App. End user cannot use JIRA Mobile app for Server instances. We have a feature request for this here:
 ** https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-46149

h3. Suggestion
 * Make documentation clear that Jira mobile App [listed here|https://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/mobile-app] is only possible for Cloud instances and not Server instances.

fields.description:
h3. Summary:

When we change the "*Header Background Color*" to white and "*Header Text Color*" to black then the Feedback icon is invisible until you hover mouse over it.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to Settings > Systems > LookAndFeel
 # Change the Header Background Color to "#ffffff" (white)
 # Change the Header Text Color to "#000000" (Black)

 
h3. Expected Results

All the Icons on the header should be visible in Black color. 
h3. Actual Results

All the Icons occur in black Except the Feedback Button.

It will appear when we hover the mouse over it.

!Feedback Button.png|thumbnail!                         !Feedback_button.png|thumbnail!

 
h3. Workaround

Use CSS script which can be added to the announcement banner which will turn the background as black for the FeedBack Button for example
{code:java}
<style>
#jira-header-feedback-link{background-color:black} 
#jira-header-feedback-link:hover{background: blue}
#logo{background-color:black} 
</style>
{code}
fields.summary: Feed Back Button Disappear when Header Background Color changed to White

fields.description:
h3. Summary

If a user is only able to view an issue because of the "Current Assignee" item in a security level, they cannot use the Assign button on an issue they are currently assigned.

h3. Environment
Jira 7.4.4, Jira 7.7.2

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Set up a security scheme/security level where a "user 1" can only view an issue because they belong to the "current assignee" group. Create another "user 2" who is included by default in the security level.
# Apply that scheme to a project.
# As "user 2", create an issue.
# User 1" should not be able to see that issue.
# Assign an issue to "user 1", it should then be viewable by "user 1".
# As that "user 1", try to assign the issue to someone else using the "assign" button.

h3. Expected Results

You can assign the issue successfully as the user is in the security level associated with the project

h3. Actual Results
The below exception is thrown in the UI and {{atlassian-jira.log}}:

- Change the assignee in the "people" area when viewing an issue. The user can edit the assignee, and the assignee is changed.

fields.description:
Hello,

when I edit a comment in Jira today, the whole comment text is selected.

!image-2018-03-06-15-23-32-968.png!

Because we write larger comments and edit them regularly you must always press an arrow key, scroll around or do a mouse click to go to the end of the comment. Sometimes we have the problem that you accidentally press a key and save before you really realize what happens, and the comment is gone.

I suggest an setting where you can configure the default behavior of the edit comment dialog from select the whole text or do not select the text at the beginning of the editing process. So my standard dialog looks like

!image-2018-03-06-15-29-44-791.png!
fields.summary: Add an option that editing a comment does not result in selected text

fields.description:
h3. *Problem Definition*
"Port" is a mandatory field in the JIRA Configuration Tool. In SQL server, if both a portNumber and instanceName are used, the portNumber will take precedence and the instanceName will be ignored. 

h3. *Suggested Solution*
Making the "Port" as an optional field

h3. *Why this is important*
So if instanceName is used, the port will have no effect, hence, the filling should be optional. Else user will need to edit it in dbconfig.xml manually which defeat the purpose of the configuration tool.
fields.summary: Making 'Port' as optional field under SQL Server Configuration

fields.description:
h3. Summary

JIRA performance is impacted by slow queries pulling data from the *customfieldvalue* table due to lack of indexing on the newly introduced *UPDATED* column.
 This issue impacts JIRA 7.5 and above.
 The issue is specifically amplified if JIRA has Service Desk installed with many SLAs defined.
 This problem also impacts JIRA reindexing speed which can be already slow for large instances.
h3. Environment
 * JIRA 7.5 and above
 * JIRA Service Desk
 * Big instances with 500k+ issues, and 500+ Custom fields.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install JIRA 7.50 or any version above.
 # Create some test data containing a lot of custom fields.
 # Try to comment on an issue or create a new issue, or run reindexing.

h3. Expected Results

Selects Queries on *customfieldvalue* should execute quickly, coming back in less than 2ms.
h3. Actual Results

The queries are not fast and in big instances can cause performance issues.
{noformat}
 $ egrep "ISSUE=" atlassian-jira-sql.log*|grep "JiraTaskExectionThread-4 user1 820x222030x1"|grep customfieldvalue |head -500|tail -2
atlassian-jira-sql.log:2018-03-01 13:43:58,550 JiraTaskExectionThread-4 user1 820x222030x1 1nlzej4 /secure/admin/IndexReIndex.jspa 2ms "SELECT ID, ISSUE, CUSTOMFIELD, UPDATED, PARENTKEY, STRINGVALUE, NUMBERVALUE, TEXTVALUE, DATEVALUE, VALUETYPE FROM customfieldvalue WHERE ISSUE='1310006' ORDER BY UPDATED ASC, ID ASC"
atlassian-jira-sql.log:2018-03-01 13:43:58,552 JiraTaskExectionThread-4 user1 820x222030x1 1nlzej4 /secure/admin/IndexReIndex.jspa 2ms "SELECT ID, ISSUE, CUSTOMFIELD, UPDATED, PARENTKEY, STRINGVALUE, NUMBERVALUE, TEXTVALUE, DATEVALUE, VALUETYPE FROM customfieldvalue WHERE ISSUE='1310006' ORDER BY UPDATED ASC, ID ASC"
$ egrep "ISSUE=" atlassian-jira-sql.log*|grep "JiraTaskExectionThread-4 user1 820x222030x1"|grep customfieldvalue |head -1000|tail -2
atlassian-jira-sql.log:2018-03-01 13:43:59,644 JiraTaskExectionThread-4 user1 820x222030x1 1nlzej4 /secure/admin/IndexReIndex.jspa 2ms "SELECT ID, ISSUE, CUSTOMFIELD, UPDATED, PARENTKEY, STRINGVALUE, NUMBERVALUE, TEXTVALUE, DATEVALUE, VALUETYPE FROM customfieldvalue WHERE ISSUE='1310004' ORDER BY UPDATED ASC, ID ASC"
atlassian-jira-sql.log:2018-03-01 13:43:59,646 JiraTaskExectionThread-4 user1 820x222030x1 1nlzej4 /secure/admin/IndexReIndex.jspa 2ms "SELECT ID, ISSUE, CUSTOMFIELD, UPDATED, PARENTKEY, STRINGVALUE, NUMBERVALUE, TEXTVALUE, DATEVALUE, VALUETYPE FROM customfieldvalue WHERE ISSUE='1310004' ORDER BY UPDATED ASC, ID ASC"
 $ egrep "ISSUE=" atlassian-jira-sql.log*|grep "JiraTaskExectionThread-4 user1 820x222030x1"|grep customfieldvalue |head -3000|tail -2
atlassian-jira-sql.log:2018-03-01 13:44:05,913 JiraTaskExectionThread-4 user1 820x222030x1 1nlzej4 /secure/admin/IndexReIndex.jspa 2ms "SELECT ID, ISSUE, CUSTOMFIELD, UPDATED, PARENTKEY, STRINGVALUE, NUMBERVALUE, TEXTVALUE, DATEVALUE, VALUETYPE FROM customfieldvalue WHERE ISSUE='1310009' ORDER BY UPDATED ASC, ID ASC"
atlassian-jira-sql.log:2018-03-01 13:44:05,922 JiraTaskExectionThread-4 user1 820x222030x1 1nlzej4 /secure/admin/IndexReIndex.jspa 2ms "SELECT ID, ISSUE, CUSTOMFIELD, UPDATED, PARENTKEY, STRINGVALUE, NUMBERVALUE, TEXTVALUE, DATEVALUE, VALUETYPE FROM customfieldvalue WHERE ISSUE='1310009' ORDER BY UPDATED ASC, ID ASC"
 $
{noformat}
The issue gets much worse if we have many custom fields and if Service Desk is installed.
 The above data is coming for a quite fast database, even though the queries are taking 2ms to complete.
 The more custom fields we have the more it will take to get the data and time add up.
fields.summary: JIRA performance is impacted by slow queries pulling data from the customfieldvalue table

fields.description:
h3. *Summary*

Clicking 'not me' in issue collector does not do anything other than hiding the message. 
*+Before:+*
 !Screen Shot 2018-03-05 at 11.53.58 PM.png|thumbnail! 
*+After:+*
 !Screen Shot 2018-03-05 at 11.54.10 PM.png|thumbnail!

h3. *Steps to Reproduce*
 # Simply set "Match reporter?" setting in issue collector configuration to "Attempt to match user session of submitter or submitter email address".
 # Prepare two web sessions, one with logged in JIRA user and one without
 (i) The JIRA user and the issue collector has to be the same JIRA instance

h3. *Expected Results*

After clicked, name and email field should be appearing since it is not the logged in user.
h3. *Actual Results*

The message is hidden and name/ email field does not appear. When you submit at this point, the user session will be used in place of the hidden name and email.
h3. *Notes*

"Match reporter?" setting in issue collector:
 (A) - Always use issue reporter
 (B) - Attempt to match user session of submitter or submitter email address
 +With option A configured:+
 # Name and email field will *always* appear
 # Name and email value will be included in the ticket description
 # Reporter of the issue will *always* be the one you set in the issue collector
 # Regardless you at that time having an active JIRA user session or not in your web browser

+With option B configured:+
 This option will attempt to assign the user to the reporter
 * +You have an active JIRA user session+

 # Name and email field will *not* appear even if you press 'not me'
 # Name and email value will *not* be included in the ticket description
 # Reporter of the issue will be the user logged in

 * +You *don't* have an active JIRA user session+

 # Name and email field will *always* appear
 # Name and email value will be included in the ticket description
 # Reporter of the issue depends on the email:
 ** If the email exists in the JIRA as one of its users, the reporter will be set to that user.
 ** If the email *not* exists, the reporter will be the one you set in the issue collector

h3. *Workaround*

There is no workaround other than asking the logged in JIRA user to log out and reload the page.
fields.summary: Issue Collector: Clicking 'not me" does not do anything else
Unable to create oAuth application link with non Atlassian applications.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When Jira fetches e-mail messages from a mailbox using its default mail handlers, configured under the *Incoming Mail* section of the admin menu, the mail handler will remove messages from the mailbox once they are read.

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide an option for the mail handlers to keep the messages on the mailbox. This is already done with the mail handlers for *Service Desk*, which use the *SEEN* flag to determine if a message has already been parsed or not.

h3. Why this is important
Some companies are required to keep mail messages for auditing purposes.
fields.summary: Option to keep e-mails in the mailbox after being processed by a mail handler

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, JIRA stores all data related to users including inactive users. The data is including emails, reported an issue, assigned issues, log work and more. GDPR (European Data Protection) includes *Right to be Forgotten* option which should allow JIRA Administrator to remove all data related to the user.

Currently, JIRA does not have a feature like this and Administrator will have to manually delete the user or bulk actions to disassociate data from the specific user.


h3. Suggested Solution

Introduce tool in JIRA to disassociate all data from inactive users to an anonymous user.


h3. Workaround

None.
fields.summary: Anonymize user activity

h3. Environment
JIRA Server

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Go to backlog and expand the Versions panel
# Click Create version
# Type a name for this version

h3. Expected Results
You can type as many characters you want.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The backslash "\" goes missing when in Visual Mode whereas appears normally in Text Mode. It goes missing when it is followed by some special characters. This causes users using Visual Mode or portals to be redirected to a broken link due to the missing backslash. Seems to be happening despite Rich Text Mode is enabled or disabled.

h3. Environment
JIRA 7.8.0
Reported on previous versions as well

h3. Expected Results
a a \ _ b b (without the spaces)

h3. Actual Results
aa\_bb

h3.Workaround
* Use Text Mode
* Use Wiki Markup for Link (E.g.: [Link Title|URL-here])
* Use ASCII Code of the special character (E.g.: "_" replace with "&#95")
fields.summary: Backslash "\" is missing in Visual Mode

fields.description:
On each documentation page that instructs how to configure Jira to connect to a database (like [Connecting JIRA applications to MySQL|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/connecting-jira-applications-to-mysql-938846854.html]) there is a full list of steps to achieve a successful connection, and at the end there is a list of known issues.

The suggestion is: given that from the 4 supported databases, only 2 have a _Known Issues_ section at the end, and that MySQL particularly has several shortcomings, it might be a good idea to highlight the known issues right at the beginning of the page, either with a warning or message indicating this, as the way to solve some of those issues is to ultimately switch to another database (like the 4-byte character issue). For comparison, here are the links to the documentation of each supported database as of Jira 7.8:
* [Connecting JIRA applications to MySQL|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/connecting-jira-applications-to-mysql-938846854.html]
* [Connecting JIRA applications to PostgreSQL|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/connecting-jira-applications-to-postgresql-938846851.html]
* [Connecting JIRA applications to SQL Server 2012|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/connecting-jira-applications-to-sql-server-2012-938846858.html]
* [Connecting JIRA applications to Oracle|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver071/connecting-jira-applications-to-oracle-802592181.html]
fields.summary: Improve visibility of known issues of Jira and MySQL in documentation

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Passing "Dießl" in {{OptionsManager#findByOptionValue}} returns an empty list even if it exists; calling {{OptionsManager#getAllOptions}} shows "Dießl".

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a list with "Dießl"
# In your code, pass "Dießl" in {{OptionsManager#findByOptionValue}}

h3. Expected Results
The returned list contains "Dießl". 

h3. Actual Results
Empty list.

h3. Notes
Seems to be caused by CaseFolding#foldString as mentioned in [DEVHELP-1018|https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/browse/DEVHELP-1018]. In Java, using {{String#toUppercase}} to "ß" changes it to "SS", hence, causes the problem.
fields.summary: com.atlassian.jira.issue.customfields.manager.OptionsManager#findByOptionValue doesn't support values with an ß character

fields.description:
h5. Issue Summary
The documentation page [Configuring JIRA's SMTP mail server to send notifications|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/configuring-jira-s-smtp-mail-server-to-send-notifications-938847638.html] states near the beginning: 
{quote}*Note:* For all of the following procedures, you must be logged in as a user with the *JIRA Administrators* [global permission|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/managing-global-permissions-938847142.html].
{quote}
Which can cause confusion due to the fact that the Global permission *Jira Administrators* allows users to turn the Outgoing Mail ON and OFF but the global permission *Jira System Administrators* (which is a different permission than *Jira Administrators)* is required to be able to actually add, remove and modify the Outgoing Mail settings.

This confusion is exacerbated by the way the Global permission for *Jira Administrators* is described in Jira: !img3.png|thumbnail!

h5. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a user in Jira
# Add the user to a group that is included in the Global Permission *Jira Administrators* but not in the *Jira System Administrators*
# Log in Jira with the newly created user and go to Jira Administration > System > Outgoing Mail

h5. Expected Behavior
* The functionality is shown, allowing the user to turn the Outgoing Mail ON or OFF, as well as being able to add, remove or edit the SMTP configuration.

h5. Actual Behavior
* The functionality is shown, only allowing the user to turn the Outgoing Mail ON or OFF.

h5. Workaround
* Give the *Jira System Administrators* global permission to the user.

h5. Notes
* The behavior is consistent across versions from 7.1 to 7.8 and it makes sense that doing a global change like the SMTP server should be done by a *Jira System Admin,* perhaps clarifying what each of the permissions allows would be enough.
fields.summary: Misleading / Incorrect Global permission for Outgoing mail configuration indicated in the documentation
REST API - Improved HTTP Authentication

fields.description: It would be great to be able to change the order of tabs ("All", "Comments", "Work Log", "History", "Activity") in an individual issue.
fields.summary: Allow administrators to change issue tabs order

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently you can not select a text field type for use in the statistic type of the pie chart.   However fields of type such as labels, versions, and select fields are all able to be used here.


h3. Suggested Solution
It would be helpful if we could use a text field in the same way we use a select field for this statistic type.


h3. Why this is important
In many instances of Jira, data has already been created in a field type of text, but then this data cannot be used to show pie chart data.  Converting this data into a select field is rather tedious to accomplish in Jira.  It would be helpful if the gadget could simply use those field types instead.
fields.summary: Allow custom fields of type "Text Field" to be used as the Statistic Type for the Pie Chart gadget

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
No current keyboard shortcut to quickly switch between Visual and Text modes when writing a comment.

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide ability to switch between Visual and Text commenting in Jira with a keyboard shortcut

h3. Why this is important
* Making comments could be faster and more efficient! 
* Improves accessibility. Keyboard shortcuts are easier to use for people with hand tremors, wrist injuries and other motor skill inhibitions than forcing them to use the mouse each time. Keyboard shortcuts are also essential for those with visual impairments and / or use screen readers.
fields.summary: Ability to switch between Text and Visual comments with a keyboard shortcut

fields.description:
h3. Summary

According to the document [Monitoring database connection usage|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/ADMINJIRASERVER076/Monitoring+database+connection+usage], the y-axis in Connection Pool graph is supposed to equal to pool-max-size but it isn't.

{quote}
The scale of the vertical axis is equal to the maximum number of connections
{quote}

h3. Environment
* (/) Jira 7.0.10 renders as expected
* (x) Jira 7.6.3 doesn't

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Increase pool-max-size to 100 in dbconfig.xml
# Access to the database monitoring page (path: /secure/admin/monitor_database.jspa)

h3. Expected Results

The y-axis takes account of the value of pool-max-size.

h3. Actual Results
The y-axis does not take account of the value of pool-max-size.

h3.Workaround
* Create support zip and refer "application-config/dbconfig.xml"
fields.summary: Connection Pool graph's y-axis doesn't take account of pool-max-size

fields.description: When using the keyboard to go up or down in ticket text, the people directory is opening instantly, when the cursor will go over a user name macro ([~...]). After this you first have to click back to the ticket description, before you can continue with scrolling up/down.
fields.summary: As Jira Software user, I would like to have a small delay, when going down in ticket-text instead of directly opening the user directory when going over the user macro [~...]

fields.description:
h3. Switching from List View to Detail View loses issue focus after page 1
h3. Environment

Tested in JIRA Software versions 7.7 and 7.8.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # In the JIRA Issue Navigator page, navigate to the second page (must have enough items to populate more than one page)
 # Switch to List View
 # Select an issue other the top issue
 # Switch to Detail View
 # The top item is now selected

h3. Expected Results

Switching from List View to Detail View on pages 2 and above would act the same as on page 1, where the selected item is retained when switching views.
h3. Actual Results

On pages 2 and above, switching from List View to Detail View always resets the issue selection to the top issue in the list.
h3. Workaround

User must manually select the issue again after changing views.
fields.summary: Switching from List View to Detail View loses issue focus after page 1

fields.description:
h3. Summary

REST api index/summary throws java.io.IOException exception
REST Doc: [https://docs.atlassian.com/jira/REST/7.2.10/#api/2/index/summary]
Java Doc: [https://docs.atlassian.com/jira/7.2.10/com/atlassian/jira/index/summary/IndexSummarizer.html]
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Trigger the REST call

h3. Expected Results

No errors in the logs
h3. Actual Results

REST call works, but the below exception is thrown in the atlassian-jira.log file:
{noformat}
2018-02-28 17:01:19,405 http-nio-8081-exec-11 INFO admin 1021x2645x1 lrl854 127.0.0.1 /rest/api/2/index/summary [c.a.j.index.ha.DefaultIndexRecoveryManager] Latest index date: {2018-02-28 15:29:01}, Latest DB date: {2018-02-28 15:29:01}
2018-02-28 17:01:19,415 http-nio-8081-exec-11 ERROR admin 1021x2645x1 lrl854 127.0.0.1 /rest/api/2/index/summary [c.a.j.issue.index.DefaultIndexManager] Error while resetting searcher: ISSUE message: java.io.IOException
com.atlassian.jira.index.DelayCloseable$AlreadyClosedException: java.io.IOException
        at com.atlassian.jira.index.DelayCloseable$Helper.close(DelayCloseable.java:77)
        at com.atlassian.jira.index.DelayCloseSearcher.close(DelayCloseSearcher.java:57)
        at com.atlassian.jira.issue.index.SearcherCache.closeSearcher(SearcherCache.java:79)
        at com.atlassian.jira.issue.index.SearcherCache.closeSearchers(SearcherCache.java:60)
        at com.atlassian.jira.issue.index.DefaultIndexManager.flushThreadLocalSearchers(DefaultIndexManager.java:1020)
        at com.atlassian.jira.util.searchers.ThreadLocalSearcherCache.resetSearchers(ThreadLocalSearcherCache.java:31)
        ... 20 filtered
        at com.atlassian.jira.servermetrics.MetricsCollectorFilter.doFilter(MetricsCollectorFilter.java:25)
        ... 26 filtered
        at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1142)
        at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:617)
        at org.apache.tomcat.util.threads.TaskThread$WrappingRunnable.run(TaskThread.java:61)
        at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:748)
Caused by: java.io.IOException
        at com.atlassian.jira.index.DelayCloseable$AlreadyClosedException.<init>(DelayCloseable.java:37)
        ... 57 more
{noformat}
h3. Notes

Under heavy load on Jira and execution of  /rest/api/2/index/summary may close index that is still being read by another thread and as a result cause  SIGSEGV like this
{code:java}
# A fatal error has been detected by the Java Runtime Environment:
#
#  SIGSEGV (0xb) at pc=0x00007f66338faaea, pid=66449, tid=0x00007f4dd99f1700
#
# JRE version: Java(TM) SE Runtime Environment (8.0_151-b12) (build 1.8.0_151-b12)
# Java VM: Java HotSpot(TM) 64-Bit Server VM (25.151-b12 mixed mode linux-amd64 )

More information why this is happening can be found here [https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LUCENE-6943?focusedCommentId=15070960&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-15070960] 
h3. Workaround

Do not use /rest/api/2/index/summary
fields.summary: REST api index/summary throws java.io.IOException exception

fields.description:

In case of Jira Datacenter node was down for quite some time, but not long enough to receive full index, it tries to catchup the replication queue from another nodes.
This is done in *NodeReindexServiceThread*, stack example:
{noformat}
NodeReindexServiceThread:thread-1 
    [java.net.SocketInputStream.socketRead0(Native Method),
    java.net.SocketInputStream.socketRead(SocketInputStream.java:116),
 ...
     com.atlassian.jira.database.DatabaseAccessorImpl.executeQuery(DatabaseAccessorImpl.java:80),
     com.atlassian.jira.database.DatabaseAccessorImpl.runInTransaction(DatabaseAccessorImpl.java:93),
     com.atlassian.jira.database.DefaultQueryDslAccessor.executeQuery(DefaultQueryDslAccessor.java:65),
     com.atlassian.jira.issue.worklog.DatabaseWorklogStore.getByIssue(DatabaseWorklogStore.java:188),

 ...
     com.atlassian.jira.issue.util.IssueObjectIssuesIterable.foreach(IssueObjectIssuesIterable.java:24),
     com.atlassian.jira.issue.index.DefaultIssueIndexer.perform(DefaultIssueIndexer.java:282),
     com.atlassian.jira.issue.index.DefaultIssueIndexer.reindexIssues(DefaultIssueIndexer.java:162),
     com.atlassian.jira.issue.index.DefaultIndexManager.reIndexIssues(DefaultIndexManager.java:571),
     com.atlassian.jira.issue.index.DefaultIndexManager.reIndexIssueObjects(DefaultIndexManager.java:468),
     sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method),
     sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:62),
     sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:43),
     java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:498),
     com.atlassian.jira.config.component.SwitchingInvocationHandler.invoke(SwitchingInvocationHandler.java:22),
     com.sun.proxy.$Proxy17.reIndexIssueObjects(Unknown Source),
     com.atlassian.jira.index.ha.DefaultNodeReindexService.updateIssueIndex(DefaultNodeReindexService.java:404),

     com.atlassian.jira.index.ha.DefaultNodeReindexService.reIndex(DefaultNodeReindexService.java:252)
{noformat}
You may not need to wait for replication to finish, for example: _you want to run Full-reindex at this node._ 
If replication is not paused,  Full-reindex process (DefaultIndexManager) will need to compete with NodeReindexServiceThread for the lock and this might fail. 
{noformat}
2018-02-28 12:24:18,466 JiraTaskExectionThread-2 ERROR admin 743x1093x1 ykx2f7 10.1.1.1 /secure/admin/jira/IndexReIndex.jspa [c.a.j.issue.index.DefaultIndexManager] Wait attempt timed out - waited 30000 milliseconds
com.atlassian.jira.issue.index.IndexException: Wait attempt timed out - waited 30000 milliseconds
...
{noformat}

h3. Suggested Solution
Add option to pause *NodeReindexServiceThread* for replication.

h3. Workaround 
* Wait until replication is done (you can use REST API to check queue length) and then do Reindex
fields.summary: As an JIRA Datacenter Administrator I want pause NodeReindexServiceThread for replication

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Thanks to the fix fo JRASERVER-38662, the following conditions that incoming mails are considered as "bulk" have been covered in the corresponding section [in the latest document|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/creating-issues-and-comments-from-email-938847641.html#Creatingissuesandcommentsfromemail-Createanewissueoraddacommenttoanexistingissue] for now.

* The first 'Precedence' header in the message is 'bulk'
* The message contains the header "Auto-Submitted" with a value different than "no"

However, the following conditions still aren't mentioned.

* The message is a "multipart/report" message and the content type contains 'report-type=delivery-status'
* The message is not a "multipart/report" message and the "Return-Path" is "<>"

h3. Suggested Solution

It would be better to mention the conditions in the document as well.
fields.summary: Update the Mail Handler documentation on what is considered a bulk message

fields.description:
Based on web browser address bar character limits, a long JQL search that results in a URL over 2000 characters causes inconsistent behavior in different web browsers

[https://stackoverflow.com/questions/417142/what-is-the-maximum-length-of-a-url-in-different-browsers]
h2. Actual results

The actual results vary based on the browser. Generally, these are errors logged to a user through the UI or a console that accompany lack of the search results.
h2. Expected results

The user is either presented with the valid search results and the usual state of the UI or is at least made aware of the JQL query affecting the URL and exceeding the limitations of modern browsers. Most likely, a workaround option is  offered to the user in the later case.
h2. Workaround

Save the long JQL search query as a filter and use its name in a new search query. The new query would look like this

filter = <name of a filter containing the long JQL>
h2. Notes

The bug was initially closed as a duplicate of JRASERVER-28494. After further investigation it became clear that the later issue did not cover the broader context of this flaw hence this one was reopened. 

The URL length limits are not imposed by the Jira itself. Nevertheless, with those limitations existing Jira features should avoid generating URLs that exceed them.
fields.summary: JQL search with URL over 2000 characters has inconsistent behavior in web browsers

fields.description:
This bug is related to JRASERVER-66859. We upgraded in AWS CloudFormation, so nodes are torn down and created anew, and they are then meant to recover from snapshot. However, the first node did not recover the index at all, and the second one did but it was corrupt. For example, dashboards not showing data, particular search results were showing 23 issues instead of 11000, etc.

Timeline:
* 07:30: Node 1 spun up, upgrade commences
* 08:00: Node 2 spun up
* 08:01: Node 2 begins to restore the index, and completes in 30s (a successful restore should take around 15 minutes)
* 08:35: We kick off a manual restore from index snapshot on Node 1
* 09:10: We realise Node 2's index is corrupt, despite the successful restore from snapshot, and we kick off another restore from snapshot
* 09:24: Index recovery completes and the indexes are both working now

NB: I confirmed that the snapshots were accessible by Jira, because we used them to recovery the indexes manually.
fields.summary: Index recovery can result in a corrupt index despite completing successfully

fields.description:
We use AWS CloudFormation to run an internal JDC instance. When we upgrade, nodes are torn down and new ones are created. They are meant to recover the index from a snapshot in the shared-home directory.

We upgraded this morning, spinning up 1 node and waiting for it to serve on /status, then spinning up another node.

Timeline:
* 07:30: Node 1 spun up, upgrade commences
* 08:00: Node 2 spun up
* 08:01: Node 2 begins to recover the index, and completes in 30s (a successful recovery should take around 15 minutes for this instance)
* 08:35: We kick off a manual restore from index snapshot on Node 1
* 09:10: We realise Node 2's index is corrupt, despite a 'successful' recovery, and we kick off another restore from snapshot on Node 2
* 09:24: Index recovery completes and the indexes are both working now

As you can see from the attached log, Node 1 did not attempt index recovery after startup at all. Node 2 did, but it seems to have synced an empty index from Node 1.

NB: I confirmed that the snapshots were accessible by Jira, because we used them to recover the indexes manually.
fields.summary: Index recovery does not run on startup automatically if a working index does not exist

fields.description:
As a system admin or a page/entity owner, I would like to limit related comment fields to 200 characters. There are some commonly known scenarios where a specific commented thread may be impacted by an emotionally unstable person that is abusing the discussion by using some illegal eristic arguments. In rhetoric, eristic refers to an argument that aims to successfully dispute another's argument, rather than searching for truth.

Therefore eristic is treated as arguing for the sake of conflict, as opposed to resolving conflict, especially in unhealthy IT environments with micromanagement misbehaving.
 I would like to have an option to set a character limit for any comment-like custom field per JIRA entity, per group or per user (by default 200 characters is perfectly fine) to significantly reduce the number of affected people (or being hurt).

In addition, as a general topic moderator I would like to have an opportunity:
 * to use utility for manual intervention by some kind of thread kick/ban action (passive post-fact mode) with optional roll-back "I apologize" mode.
 * enable an automated pro-active filter for managing emotions and keeping the level of discussion based on a specific threshold value. Ideally, for the first stage, the filter would be predefined and builtin in the system, based on Schopenhauer's eristic methods classification (stratagems). The purpose of such feature would be detecting and marking with a "poo" emoji all these dishonest and fraudulent debate opponents.
fields.summary: Limit comment field to 200 characters

fields.description:
h4. Summary
Email notification when an issue is moved from Software to Service Desk project that has newly associated priority scheme and priorities.

h4. Steps to reproduce:

(!) You need outgoing mail activated.
# Create a new priority scheme with new priorities.
# Associate new priority scheme with a Service Desk Project.
# Create an issue in a Jira Software project.
# Move the issue from the Software to the Service Desk Project.
# Select one of the priorities(from the new scheme) as the new priority in the issue.

h4. Expected Result:

The Issue is moved to the new project and a notification is sent informing the participants that the issue was moved.

h4. Actual Result:
h4. 
The issue is moved to the new project correctly but the e-mail sent has the following error message:

{noformat}
An error occurred whilst rendering this message. Please contact the administrators, and inform them of this bug. Details: ------- org.apache.velocity.exception.MethodInvocationException: Invocation of method 'getPrettyFieldString' in class com.atlassian.jira.util.JiraVelocityHelper threw exception com.atlassian.jira.issue.customfields.impl.FieldValidationException: Invalid priority name 'Medium (not available)'. at templates/email/html/includes/fields/changelog.vm[line 32, column 50] at org.apache.velocity.runtime.parser.node.ASTMethod.handleInvocationException(ASTMethod.java:337) at org.apache.velocity.runtime.parser.node.ASTMethod.execute(ASTMethod.java:284) at org.apache.velocity.runtime.parser.node.ASTReference.execute(ASTReference.java:262) at org.apache.velocity.runtime.
{noformat}

h4. Workaround:

There's no workaround to prevent this from happening. The error message is only sent when the issue is moved, the subsequent notifications(comments, status changes) are sent correctly with no errors.
fields.summary: Email Notification sends errors after issue move with new priority.

h3. Problem
Let's say I'd like to whitelist a URL that looks like [https://jira.atlassian.com/#/boards|https://jira.atlassian.com/#/boards] but it's not possible with any expression types as mentioned in [this documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver077/configuring-the-whitelist-945533568.html#Configuringthewhitelist-TypeSectionExpressiontypes]. We can only whitelist [https://jira.atlassian.com/*|https://jira.atlassian.com/*] at the moment.

h3. Suggestion
Allow '#' to be specified in the whitelist URL either with regular expression, wildcard or exact match.

fields.description:
h3. Summary:
This is related to the KB [Development Panel Missing When Viewing Issue|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/development-panel-missing-when-viewing-issue-420975853.html] Cause No.3. While the Admin could always refresh the connection through the Project Settings, there still cases that it won't be that easy like:
# JIRA Admin is away at that time or in different time zone.
# There are multiple projects that are connected to Development Tools and we need to refresh it one by one

JIRA should have a service that will automatically update the cache as soon as the Development Tools is reachable if this was the cause rather than having an admin manually update it.

h3. Steps to Reproduce:
# Integrate JIRA with Bitbucket.
# Make a commits through Bitbucket Repo that mentions JIRA tickets inside.
# Confirm that JIRA showed the related commits.
# Stop both instances.
# Start JIRA only.
# Wait around 5~10 Minutes and start Bitbucket.
# After Bitbucket is up and running, check the "Application Link" page to see that the status is "Connected".
# Check the commit mentioned tickets in JIRA.

h3. Expected Result:
- JIRA to show the Development Panel with the commit.

h3. Actual Result:
- No Development Panel is showing on the ticket.

h3. Notes:
- Tested with JIRA 7.8.0 and Bitbucket Server 5.8.0
- I've waited for more than 1 hour to check whether JIRA able to solve this by refreshing the page from time to time and in which it is not. It will show the old Source tab asking for authentication instead.
- Even after authenticating, the Development Panel still not showing rather, the information will be shown in the Source tab what has been long deprecated.
- Without the Admin help to refresh the Development Panel, users would not able to view the commits/builds
- If this were a cache issue, JIRA should just show the panel with the old commits and mention about it that it needs Admin to refresh it rather than silently hide it.

h3. Workaround:
- Navigate to _Project Settings > Development Tools > Click Refresh_
fields.summary: Development Panel would not show if JIRA is started before any of the connected Development Tools application

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently in Jira server 7.7.0, a project administrator cannot control the notification settings for that project.   Only Jira Admin or Jira system Admin can change such settings.

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow project admin to change notification settings.   Of course we would expect this to follow the same conventions that other project administrator rights were given.  For example, in order to change workflow settings, you need to make sure that this workflow was only assigned to this single project.   In turn, this would still only be possible if the notification scheme was assigned to this single project.

h3. Why this is important
promote more granular levels of project control to users in the project admin role.
fields.summary: Project administrator should be able to change notification settings

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-6851].
  {panel}


In the custom field configuration context, it is not possible to  choose a project if it has already been associated to another configuration context of the same custom field. For instance, it is not possible to make the following associations:

Task, project1, configuration context 1
Task, project2, configuration context 2
Bug, project1, configuration context 3
Bug, project2, configuration context 4
fields.summary: Allow more than one custom field context to be associated with the same project but different issue types

fields.description:
It would be nice if users had the ability to configure whether or not filters are executed upon page load, especially for the "Search for issues" link in the "Issues" drop-down.

This link loads a paged list of all issues that are visible to the user. Since this is rarely what users want to see, it would make sense for this page to not execute a search at all, and simply allow the user to specify the filter configuration before executing a search. That would save some time and CPU usage on the server whenever this link is clicked.
fields.summary: Don't always execute filter on page load

Add support for Microsoft Teams internal Browser

fields.description:
h3. Summary:
In case JIRA is started before any of the Development Tools application is starting, JIRA would not show the Development Panel at all until it can reach any of the Applications.

h3. Steps to Reproduce:
# Integrate JIRA with Bitbucket.
# Make a commits through Bitbucket Repo that mentions JIRA tickets inside.
# Confirm that JIRA showed the related commits.
# Stop both instances
# Start JIRA only.

h3. Expected Result:
- JIRA would at least show the old commits.

h3. Actual Result:
- The development panel is missing.

h3. Notes:
- If this is expected, when Bitbucket is down while JIRA is still running, the Development Panel should be missing but, this seems to be not the case. If we stop Bitbucket before JIRA, it still showing the old commits with a warning says that there is a problem with the connection. This should be showing as well when JIRA is starting first before Bitbucket rather than hiding the panel altogether.
- JIRA should be able to get the old data without working connection as it is stored in the database.

h3. Workaround:
- Refresh the connection from _Project Settings > Development Tools_
fields.summary: Development Panel should not depends on Application Link connection

fields.description:
h3. Summary
During plugin (add-on) installs/updates/delete/disable action UPM will flush the large number of caches (see JRASERVER-64908). 
For Jira datacenter this cache flush will be propagated to other nodes, thus affecting them. Also cache flush is triggered during node startup as UPM needs to register and load modules from plugins. 


h3. Environment
* Jira datacenter 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Upgrade plugin (or start node)
# Check performance 

h3. Expected Results
* Starting new node will not have significant impact for cluster 
* Plugin action will not cause cache flush to be propagated to other nodes, only plugin events. 
** Plugin action will have performance impact due to JRASERVER-64908 and nature of action, but it will be isolated 

h3. Actual Results
* Starting new node has significant impact for cluster 
* Plugin action causes cache flush to be propagated to other nodes, making cluster wide replication storm and putting extra load to DB.

h3. Notes
None

h3.Workaround
* Please plan any plugin actions updates/delete/disable (UPM actions) during low peak hours or maintenance windows. 
* Please plan node start-up during low peak hours or maintenance windows (start one node at a time).
fields.summary: UPM actions have significant impact on JIRA Datacenter performance

fields.description:
I just upgraded to JIRA v7.8.0 (latest).

To my surprise, after upgrade I learned that 7 of our add-ons are not compatible with this version.

I reached out to each add-on developer requesting them to update and become compatible, but my bigger concern and the reason for this request is that nowhere on the add-on overview screen does the add-on state up to which version of JIRA the add-on is compatible with (see screen shot attached).

If I had know these add-ons were only compatible with v.X.X.X then I would have only upgraded JIRA to vX.X.X and waited until all add-ons were completely compatible with the latest version before upgrading.

Please consider implementing this key piece of information.

 

Thank you.
fields.summary: Add-ons Need to Indicate which JIRA Version they are Compatible With

fields.description:
The change of issue type is considered a "move" event, but it could cause misunderstanding as the issue will be "edited" when the issue type is changed.

In order to prevent this from happening, you may use the workflow property "jira.permission.move.denied". However, please note this will also prevent the issue from being moved to another project.

We could improve this by allowing a "Move" to happen, but only to a different project and not to a different issue type in the same project.
fields.summary: "jira.issue.editable=false" and "jira.permission.edit.denied" workflow properties should not allow for issue type to be changed

fields.description:
We faced an issue recently when a user set up 100 subscriptions against filters and selected a notification period of every 15mins for each filter. The reult of this was he was receiving over 8000 emails per day and they almost succeeded in crashing our email server.

We would like to be able to modify the subscription frequency  periods available to our users and our suggestion would be to set the periods available as parametrs (perhaps managed in the DB and thes ecould be flagged as being actiive or inactive. The Jira Administrator should have the ability then to select which subsrciption periods could be selected.

This woul dporvide more flexibility ion the applications and the variables selecetd could be passed to the cron jobs as a variable.
fields.summary: Enable Jira administrators to define what subscription periods are available for users to select

fields.description:
This is based on feedback from two developers in the Atlassian Community: https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-questions/dialog2-aui-select-problem-with-aria-hidde/qaq-p/685426

Outside of Jira, an autocomplete control in an AUI dialog only fires its change event once.

In Jira, in any kind of dialog -- either {{JIRA.FormDialog}} or AUI's dialog -- it fires three times.
fields.summary: Events for Jira autocomplete controls in a dialog fire 3 times

fields.description:
h3. Summary

If a username with username like *00163557* is created in JIRA and the username is added to project role, the username cannot be removed from the role page.

+Steps to reproduce+

# Create a user with *00163557* username.
# Add the username to any roles.
# Try to remove it.

* Unable to replicate the problem with username like *163557* & *00vicky*.


h3. Environment

JIRA 7.7.1, 7.6.3, 7.5.3


h3. Expected Results

User able to remove the username from the role.


h3. Actual Results

Browser refreshes the page and the username is not removed from the role.


h3.Workaround

The user can be removed from the database using the query below:

{code}
select * from projectroleactor where roletypeparameter = 'affectedusername';
{code}

{code}
delete from projectroleactor where roletypeparameter = 'affectedusername';
{code}
fields.summary: Unable to remove users in role with numerical value in username

fields.summary: Disable the “delete closed sprint” permission

fields.description:
h3. Summary
After resizing window that shows issue with some components defined and editing components, components count sometimes shows as wrong and with redundant artefacts for "minimizing" all the components.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open an issue with multiple components defined
# Resize the window
# Edit Components field

h3. Expected Results
"Minimized" components count should be correct and no additional icons should be displayed

h3. Actual Results
* After editing, wrong number of "minimized" components appear (in this case, it should show 4 more components that are minimized):
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
* After expanding the number of "minimized" components (clicking on three dots icon), sometimes two exact icons for minimizing components appear:
 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 

h3.Workaround
None
fields.summary: Components count wrong and extra artefacts appear after resizing window and editing components
Make it easier to apply multiple Issue collectors.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Menu items like Dashboard, Projects, Issues contain HTML tags in the Spanish translation, it has <u> and </u> on the labels.
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install a fresh JIRA instance using version 7.8.0.
 # Change the default or profile language to Spanish.

h3. Expected Result
The menu labels on the Jira top header bar are translated properly and correctly.

h3. Actual Result
Some menu labels have HTML tags.

h3. Workarounds
While the issue is officially resolved, you may use the Jira 7.7.0 Language pack in the following way:  
# Download the Jira 7.7.0 Spanish Lang Pack: [^jira-core-language-pack-es_ES-7.7.0.v20180108103548.jar]
# Go to <Jira Installation Folder>/WEB-INF/atlassian-bundled-plugins/ 
# locate and remove the file jira-core-language-pack-es_ES-7.#.#.v#############.jar (you may want to back it up somewhere...)
# Place the Jira 7.7.0 Lang pack in the directory.
# Restart Jira.

* This will fix most of the regressions introduced in the language packs of Jira 7.7.2 and 7.8. 
* This workaround originally suggested the pack from Jira 7.7.1 but it seems it had a few translation errors already in it, so 7.7.0 seems a better fix, even if it is just temporary.
fields.summary: Dashboard, Projects and other menu items contains HTML tags in the Spanish translation

fields.description:
We used to use the [Jira Syntax Highlighter Plugin|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/archive/jira.plugin.syntaxhighlighter.macro.syntaxplugin] before (mostly because the old code-markdown didn't support C#) and were delighted to see that newer versions extended on the language support (which now includes C# by default). As such, the plugin has been discontinued.

One feature we still miss though is the ability to specify whether a code-block should include line numbers or not; whether to start line numbering in a different place (other than 1) and whether to highlight certain lines.

For example, the following would show the lines 305-310 of Program.cs and highlight lines 307-309 to bring them to the developers attention:
{noformat}{code:csharp|title=Program.cs|linenumbers|firstline=305|highlight=307-309}private static void DoSomething(string someValue, out int someNumber)
{
    someNumber = 42; // why 42?
    if (someValue == null) // use string.IsNullOrEmpty instead
        throw new NullReferenceException("someBalue"); // typo, plus should use nameof(...)
    someNumber = int.Parse(someValue);{code}
{noformat}

At this point, only the title will be shown (since it had been supported before, also with  noformat and panel markdown).
And by the way, and thoughts on allowing alternate language specifiers ("csharp" vs. "c#)? A lot of our older issues have the former and will not render correctly at this point.
fields.summary: Allow line numbers and line highlighting for code-blocks

fields.description: The version of the bundled Atlassian Application Links plugin was vulnerable to XSS. See https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/browse/APL-1361 for more details.
fields.summary: The bundled Atlassian Application Links plugin had various XSS issues - CVE-2018-5227

fields.description:
I noticed there is a feature, where when the user clicks on the issue description, a pop-up text editor allowing you to edit. However, this also causes inconvenience which affects efficiency as a whole as developers would need to copy and paste snippets of information via the pop-up editor, instead of the main Jira issue window instead. This is definitely that a user experience interaction process which we expect.

As a result, mistakes such as accidental editing (or worse, deletion of certain part of the text) could happen, when it could be easily prevented with just allowing to be set at a user level, instead of by admins (I would suspect that a small group of users might prefer to leave it as enabled).

I hope you would at least consider allowing this feature to be customized by users. While it is not feature-breaking, but its a very annoying and an issue that could have been prevented.
fields.summary: "Click to Edit" Feature should be disabled by default, and customizable by user/project

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When creating a Crucible review starting from a Jira issue, the review Objectives field will contain different information sent by Jira depending on if the 'Create review' (for a single changeset) or 'Create review for all commits' was clicked in the Development Panel modal window and if the Jira issue contains a description.
 
h3. Environment
* Jira 7.5.0 applinked to Fisheye/Crucible 4.5.0
* Application link fully functional using OAuth (without impersonation)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open the Development Panel modal window:
!image4.jpg|thumbnail!
# When using the 'Create review' link for a specific changeset listed, regardless if the Jira issue contains a description or not, the changeset ID turned into a link is referenced in the Crucible review Objectives field, along with its commit message:
 !image1.jpg|thumbnail!
# When using the 'Create review for all commits' option, if the Jira issue *has* a description, the review Objectives field will contain the Jira issue description:
 !image2.jpg|thumbnail!
# When using the 'Create review for all commits' option, if the Jira issue *does not have* a description, the review Objectives field will contain a list of the changeset IDs turned into links, and their respective commit messages:
 !image3.jpg|thumbnail!

h3. Expected Results
Jira should send consistent information to the Crucible review, when either the 'Create review' or the 'Create review for all commits' link is clicked, to be added in the Objectives field. It should either:
# Send the issue description *along with* the list of commits IDs and their messages
# Send *just* the issue description or *just* the list of commits IDs and their messages

h3. Actual Results
Jira sends inconsistent information to the Crucible review depending on if the 'Create review' (for a single changeset) or 'Create review for all commits' was clicked and on if the issue contains a description.

h3. Workaround
There are no known workarounds.
fields.summary: Inconsistent behavior when creating Crucible reviews from Jira issues

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When using Shift+Del and Shift+Insert shortcuts to cut the text and paste it, this doesn't work when editing text in Visual mode

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a comment
# Write text in Visual mode
# Use Shift+Delete to cut the text and Shift+Insert to try pasting it back

h3. Expected Results
The text should be pasted from the clipboard.

h3. Actual Results
The text isn't pasted in the clipboard. Instead it pastes the on copied previously or doesn't paste anything.

h3.Workaround
Use Ctrl+X and Ctrl+V for cutting and pasting text, respectively.

h3. Notes
* This doesn't happen when editing text in Text mode.
* Tested on Firefox and Chrome, on Windows and Linux.
fields.summary: Shift+Del and Shift+Insert combination don't work in Visual mode

fields.description:
*Current Behavior / Summary*

JIRA application licenses are managed from the Versions & Licenses page. Admins working with licenses sometimes encounter errors. 

A frequent error comes when an admin is updating their application for JIRA Software and/or JIRA Service Desk when they do not have a license for JIRA Core. 
* JIRA Core presents a *Paste License* link and this link can be mistaken for the place where all licenses should be added. 

Admin adds license and gets error:

{quote}
The license could not be installed.

This license is not for the selected product. 
Please make sure that the license is for the selected product and contact Support if the issue continues.
{quote}

*Suggested Change*

Reduce likelihood of encountering the error described above.
* Could change to say "Paste JIRA Core License" 
* Could remove this option and add license box and buttons similar to if a license were present (except the license would be empty or have placeholder)
** Advantage would be that this would add consistency between the three applications
* Could add additional messaging to the JIRA Core section when it is unlicensed, making it more obvious that this is where the admin would add a JIRA Core license to  "enable" or "activate" JIRA Core users (implying that it's a new thing, not the place to change an existing license)
fields.summary: Change Paste License link on Versions and Licenses page

fields.description:
The Server Version of the [Migrating from JIRA Cloud to Server applications | https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/migrating-from-jira-cloud-to-server-applications-938846963.html] documentation under step *4. Import your data from JIRA Cloud into JIRA Server* has a  note:
{quote}
If your backup is 2 GB or more, import the attachments separately

For large backups, we recommend that the attachments are imported separately. To do this:
# Unzip the backup file.
# Compress the activeobjects.xml and the entities.xml files only.
# Import the compressed file in the setup wizard, as described above.
# Copy the contents of the attachments directory into the <home-directory>/data/attachments directory for JIRA Server.
{quote}

In the context of the document this is completely incorrect, as *Regardless of the size of the backup* the /data directory MUST be separated from the .xml backup data then the activeobject.xml and entities.xml re-packaged into a single zip file to import correctly


The Cloud Backup when attachments are included is in the format:
{code}
JIRA-backup-XXXXX.zip
├── activeobjects.xml
├── entities.xml
├── data
│   ├── attachments
│   └── avatars
│   └── logos logos
{code}

This backup Must be extracted and repackaged as:
{code}
JIRA-backup.zip
├── activeobjects.xml
├── entities.xml
{code}

With the attachments & avatars moved into the proper path on the filesystem before importing the data, if the data folder is left in the backup the import will fail with an unrecognized file type.


In The [Cloud Version Of this Document | https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/migrating-from-jira-cloud-to-server-applications-776636236.html#MigratingfromJiraCloudtoServerapplications-4.Copyacrossattachments] a similar notation is made but further indicating at the next step to  separate the data if attachments were included which adds in clarification:
{quote}
4. Copy across attachments
If you included your attachments in the export:
     1. Extract the backup file that was downloaded.
     2. Copy across the contents of the attachments folder to the $JIRA_HOME/data/attachments directory for Jira Server.
{quote}

But this is still incorrect as the notation still states:
{quote}
For instances with large backups (2Gigabyte and up), we recommend importing the attachments separate from the Issue and user data.
{quote}

Indicating to copy across the attachments after importing the data which has a high potential for data loss leading customers into a senario where they would need to follow this recovery option:
- https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/resolve-missing-attachments-in-jira-236585433.html

*Recommendations for a successful import is to have attachments in place prior to importing the data*
fields.summary: Cloud to Server Migration Documentation Update

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When email is marked high or low, the X-Priority header is set and a corresponding high or low priority is set on the ticket in JIRA. The issue is when the email is not marked high or low (normal email), then there is no X-Priority header set and email handler is not using the default priority as defined with Priority Schema for that project. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Define Priority Scheme for the project and set default priority
# Configure incoming mail handler
# Send email without high / low priority
# JIRA opens issue

h3. Expected Results
Email should use the default priority settings for the Priority Schema.

h3. Actual Results
No X-Priority in email header so not using default priority. Instead, JIRA sets the default priority of the default priority scheme, even though that project is not using the default priority scheme.

h3. Workaround
Non at this time.
fields.summary: The issue is when the email is not marked high or low (normal email), then there is no X-Priority header is set.

fields.summary: Improve Performance of Assignee Field

fields.description:
I realize this has been suggested and closed, but since we pay thousands of dollars a year for this software I am going to say it again.

Labels need *some* level of control.  People use whatever naming convention make sense in their head, and it makes for labels very quickly becoming useless.  As the manager of our bug databases,it is up to *me* to ensure that data is as accurate as possible.  When we search by label and miss issues because someone accidentally misspelled something, we cause problems.

This level of data integrity *critical* in some use cases.

You don't have to change the feature completely, just give us a new type of restricted label.
fields.summary: Allow Admin to restrict Labels on bugs

fields.description: I would like the priority field to still be visible when an issue has been flagged, instead of having the flag replace the priority field.
fields.summary: Display Priority field and flag on same issue

This bug is related to [JRASERVER-62850 - Update Confluence Links In JIRA Automatically Base On The New Applink Configurations|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-62850]


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create application link with new URL
# Give the affected project a browse anyone group permission

h3. Expected Results
# Confluence links should be still showing one URL consistently 

h3. Actual Results
# If the user is logged out but able to view the issue, the old Confluence link will be displayed
!Screen Shot 2018-02-20 at 9.01.22 PM.png|thumbnail! 
# If the user is logged in the new Confluence link will be displayed. 
#  !Screen Shot 2018-02-20 at 9.01.56 PM.png|thumbnail! 

 
h3. Notes
# The old confluence links are still visible in the entities.xml file :
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h3.Workaround
This issue can be solved by taking the steps at [Application Link Issue When Moving JIRA and Confluence|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/application-link-issue-when-moving-jira-and-confluence-to-different-environment-856843626.html] for now.
fields.summary: Confluence Links In JIRA does not display correct URL when logged out

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When an email address is being pasted on the comment using Visual Mode, the previous word is being added to the hyperlink after hitting the spacebar.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open any JIRA issue.
 # Add a comment - type something like "go to <paste an email address><hit spacebar>".
 # The result will be "go [to mmuthusamy@atlassian.com|mailto:to%C2%A0mmuthusamy@atlassian.com] ".

h3. Expected Results

The comment to be "go to [mmuthusamy@atlassian.com|mailto:mmuthusamy@atlassian.com]  ".
h3. Actual Results

To comment is "go [to mmuthusamy@atlassian.com|mailto:to%C2%A0mmuthusamy@atlassian.com] ".
 (i) Notice that the "to" is added to the hyperlink.
h3. Workaround
 * Edit the content via Text mode.
OR
 * Use Text mode instead.
fields.summary: Rich text editor renders email address wrongly

fields.description:
h5. Issue Summary
 * Recently Created gadget is missing translation in all its labels

h5. Steps to Reproduce
 * Go to a Dashboard
 * Add the gadget _Recently Created_
 ** The issue was reported for Deutsch but this happens even in English

h5. Expected Behavior
 * Dates are translated correctly
 * Buttons have text that indicate what each button does.
 * All the labels include a meaningful, translated message.

h5. Actual Behavior
 * The dates included in the graph are always in English.
 * Buttons do not have any text
 * All the labels are untranslated and show a key instead

!screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!
h5. Cause
 * -Possibly keys that are not translated.-

h5. Notes:
 * It seems the gadget at some point was correctly translated as we see in [this documentation page from Jira 6.4|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira064/adding-the-recently-created-chart-gadget-720417043.html] but from Jira 7.0 onwards, the translation issue is present.
fields.summary: Recently Created gadget is missing translation in all its labels

fields.description:
h3. Problem

When accessing "Running JIRA applications as a Windows service" documentation such [as this one|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver071/running-jira-applications-as-a-windows-service-802593173.html], we can see a few statements (section: Troubleshooting) with mentions to Java 6 and limitations regarding 64-bit operation systems and Jira.
h3. Suggestion

Since Jira 7 and afterward versions do not support Java 6 and we don't have the mentioned limitation (You cannot run JIRA as a service on a 64-bit operating system if you require allocating more than 1.5GB of memory, due to 32-bit JDK memory limitations and 64-bit JDK/Tomcat service issues.), it would be nice to remove these statements off.
fields.summary: Improve server documentation regarding Jira as a service (Windows)

fields.description:
I know the summary may sound confusing but it was the best way i could think of describing what i want to do. To better explain, i have the following example of what i would like to accomplish.

I have 3 issue types in JIRA Service Desk - Event, Incident and Known Error.

I want to be able to display a list of all Known Error issue types having the same value as a specific field or group of fields within created Event and Incident issue types, in the actual Event and Incident view screens (possibly using JQL to get the list of Known Errors)

Is there a way i can do this within JIRA natively or possibly an add-on that can assist with getting this done?
fields.summary: Show issue types with related fields within each ticket of a different issue type

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Suppose that incoming mail handler is defined and users send mails in order to open new tickets. If the email, for some reason, couldn't create a new ticket or leave comment, the user won't get notified on the error.

h3. Suggested Solution
Implement functionality of sending mail responses to a user with explanation on why the mail wasn't created (for example, if the following error is encountered experienced [JRASERVER\-36135: Add support for 4 byte characters in MySQL connection|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-36135], users would get notified that their mail wasn't processed because of emoji symbols present).

h3. Workaround
None
fields.summary: Ability to notify users on why their mail didn't initiate ticket creation or new comment in JIRA
